⚠️ Local Public Health Alert: The Michigan Department of Health & Human Services has confirmed 2 human cases of Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE) in Southwest Michigan. EEE has also infected animals including 7 horses and 2 deer.

People can be infected with EEE from the bite of a mosquito carrying the virus. The disease is not spread from animal to humans. Read more below or visit our website at www.vbcassdhd.org. Residents are urged to protect themselves against mosquito bites by wearing long clothing, using repellent and removing standing water where mosquitoes breed.

By taking the extra time to prevent mosquito and tick bites this summer you lower your risk of contracting a disease that may stick with you the rest of your life.
